name: The Rustbucket Scrapyard (C-Rank)
description:
A canyon filled with the rusted detritus of an ancient war machine graveyard. The air is filled with the sound of clanging metal and manic, high-pitched laughter. A goblin clan has taken up residence and is building something dangerous. Your objective is to neutralize the threat and investigate the purpose of their construction.

Progression

Draw the next card from this Region Deck: 'Scouting the Perimeter'.

name: Scouting the Perimeter
description:
Goblin patrols are guarding the entrance to the main junk piles. You need to clear a path before you can venture deeper.

Objective

Defeat the goblin patrol to secure an entrance.

Journey

Make a Journey Roll to navigate the razor-sharp scrap metal surrounding the camp. Your destination is the 'Scrap Heap Ambush' Location Card.

Progression

Upon arriving, begin a Timed Scene using the 'Scrap Heap Ambush' card for setup.

name: Scrap Heap Ambush
description:
A narrow, 8x12 path winds through towering piles of unstable, rusted metal. Goblins lie in wait among the junk.

Setup

  • **Map:** 8x12 grid (A-H columns, 1-12 rows).
  • **Terrain:** All squares in columns 1, 2, 7, and 8 are **Junk Piles** (Difficult Terrain & Cover).
  • **Enemies:** Place 2 'Goblin Stabber' creatures at C8 and F8. Place 1 'Goblin Net-Trapper' at D10.
  • **Players:** Start on any square in row 1.

Objective

Defeat all enemies.

Progression

Once all enemies are defeated, draw the next card: 'The Boom Gate'.

name: Goblin Stabber
description:
A scrawny goblin with a rusty shank and a nasty grin.

Shank**Active** (Melee) Deals HD damage. If the target is adjacent to another goblin, deals +2 damage.

Combat AI (Medium INT)

  1. **Step 1: Determine Target:** The enemy with the **lowest current HP**.
  2. **Step 2: Determine Action:**
    • If the Stabber is adjacent to the Target AND the Target is adjacent to another ally: Use **Shank** (for +2 damage).
    • Otherwise: Use a basic melee attack.
  3. **Step 3: Movement:** Moves up to its SPEED (6). Follows the **INT 0** General Movement AI rule. It prioritizes moving to a square adjacent to the Target AND adjacent to another ally if possible.

name: Goblin Net-Trapper
description:
Stays at range, trying to entangle foes with weighted nets.

Throw Net**Active** (Range 6) Ranged attack. Target must Defy Danger (DEX) or become **Immobilized** for 1 round.

Combat AI (High INT)

  1. **Step 1: Determine Target:** The enemy with the **highest HD** (most immediate physical threat).
  2. **Step 2: Determine Action:**
    • If the Target is within **Throw Net range (6)** and **NOT** already Immobilized: Use **Throw Net**.
    • Otherwise: Use a basic melee attack.
  3. **Step 3: Movement:** Moves up to its SPEED (5). Follows the **INT +1 or higher** General Movement AI rule (avoids Difficult Terrain, seeks Cover). It prioritizes moving to a square that places the Target within **Throw Net range (6)** while maintaining at least 3 squares of distance from the closest enemy.

name: The Boom Gate
description:
You've reached the entrance to the main workshop, but it's blocked by a reinforced gate rigged with erratic gnomish explosives the goblins scavenged.

Objective

Bypass the trapped gate.

Progression

Begin a Timed Scene. Use the 'Rigged Entrance' Location Card for setup.

name: Rigged Entrance
description:
A 6x6 area in front of a large metal gate (Wall along row 6). A complex, ticking explosive device is strapped to the center (üîç at C6, D6). No enemies present.

Disarm the Bomb

An adjacent character (A5, B5, C5, D5, E5, F5, A7, B7, C7, D7, E7, F7) can use an Action to Investigate.
Roll+INT (to disarm) or Roll+DEX (to pry it off quickly).
On a 16+: You disarm the device and the gate swings open.

On a 9-15: You trigger a small charge. You take 1d6 fire damage, but the gate blows open.

Peril (1-8): Massive explosion! All characters in the scene take 2d6 fire damage. The gate is destroyed.

Progression

Once the gate is open (by disarming or explosion), draw the next card: 'Boss: The Scrap Titan'.

name: Boss: The Scrap Titan
description:
Inside the workshop, Chief Sparkfizzle sits atop a massive, hulking construct made of welded scrap metal, boiler plates, and spinning gears. "You're just in time to test my masterpiece!" he cackles.

Objective

Defeat Chief Sparkfizzle and his Scrap Titan.

Progression

Begin a Timed Scene. Use the 'Main Assembly Floor' Location Card for setup.

name: Main Assembly Floor
description:
A large, open 12x12 workshop littered with tools and oil stains.

Setup

  • **Map:** 12x12 grid (A-L columns, 1-12 rows).
  • **Enemies:** Place 'The Scrap Titan' (Boss) at G6 (it occupies a 2x2 space: G6, H6, G7, H7). Place 2 'Goblin Stabbers' at C4 and J4.
  • **Players:** Start on any square in row 12.

Progression

When 'The Scrap Titan' is defeated, draw the final card: 'Scrapyard Salvage'.

name: The Scrap Titan
description:
A towering, piloted mech made of rusted iron, venting steam and oil.

Boss Creature: Draw 1 random Gold and 1 random Red Feature card and attach them.

Heavy Plating**Passive** Reduces all incoming physical damage (HD) by 2.
Steam Vent**Active** (Adjacent) All adjacent characters must Defy Danger (DEX) or take 1d6 MD fire damage and be **Pushed 1**.
Crushing Claw**Active** (Melee) Deals HD damage. On a critical hit, the target is **Stunned** for 1 round.

Combat AI (High INT)

  1. **Step 1: Determine Target:** The enemy with the **highest total damage output (HD+MD)** in the previous turn.
  2. **Step 2: Determine Action:**
    • If three or more enemies are adjacent to the Titan's 2x2 area: Use **Steam Vent**.
    • If the Target is adjacent: Use **Crushing Claw** on them.
    • Otherwise: Use a basic ranged attack (MD) on the closest enemy within range (6).
  3. **Step 3: Movement:** Moves up to its SPEED (4). Follows the **INT +1 or higher** General Movement AI rule (actively avoids all hazards/Difficult Terrain). It prioritizes moving to a square that places a high number of enemies adjacent to its large 2x2 frame.

name: Scrapyard Salvage
description:
With the Titan destroyed and Chief Sparkfizzle fleeing, the remaining goblins scatter. You rifle through the workshop, finding a stash of stolen coins and a peculiar piece of technology.

Reward

The party receives 200 gold total. You find the 'Overclocked Goggles' rare item.

Scenario Complete

You have completed this region's story. If this Region Deck had a Key Token on it, you now claim it. Discard all remaining cards in this deck. The session ends. Proceed to the Post-Session Phase (Downtime & Progression).

name: Overclocked Goggles
description:
Brass goggles with multiple spinning lenses that whir softly. They analyze weaknesses in real-time.

Target Analysis

When you use the Volley action, you can spend 1 MP. If you do, roll with advantage. If the attack is a High Hit (16+), it ignores 2 points of the target's Armor.
